claims.statement: Diagnostic ultrasound (1-3 MHz, 0.1-3 W/cm²) delivers insufficient mechanical energy to the OMM to reorganize lipid domains directly; attenuation and spatial averaging reduce local OMM stress to sub-threshold levels (<1 pN/nm²).
claims.falsifiable_reason: It specifies a concrete experimental condition (Laurdan GP changes during diagnostic-intensity insonation) that would disprove OMM lipid order alteration.
claims.feasible_reason: Laurdan GP imaging is a standard fluorescence microscopy technique for lipid order in live cells or isolated mitochondria.
claims.novel_reason: It enables a quantitative test distinguishing diagnostic US insufficiency from therapeutic effects, anchoring frequency-specific predictions in the research program.

claims.statement: Low-frequency therapeutic ultrasound (20-100 kHz) at higher intensities can induce cavitation-mediated local stresses sufficient to perturb OMM lipid organization, but this operates through transient cavitation rather than direct mechanical coupling.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It implies suppression of effects in degassed media (cavitation-free) would disprove cavitation mediation.
claims.feasible_reason: Degassing media and applying low-frequency US with lipid imaging are routine in ultrasound biophysics labs.
claims.novel_reason: It differentiates cavitation-dependent mechanisms, enabling controls for direct mechanical vs. indirect effects on OMM.

claims.statement: VDAC1 oligomeric state is lipid-environment-dependent, with cholesterol stabilizing monomeric/honeycomb states and cholesterol depletion promoting oligomerization-competent dispersed states.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts no oligomerization change with MβCD cholesterol depletion, directly testing lipid dependence.
claims.feasible_reason: MβCD treatment followed by VDAC1 crosslinking or FRET assays uses standard biochemical and imaging tools.
claims.novel_reason: It links specific lipids to VDAC1 states, enabling synthesis with US perturbation for mechanistic validation.

claims.statement: Cancer cell OMMs, with elevated cholesterol, would paradoxically be MORE resistant to mechanically-induced VDAC1 oligomerization at moderate perturbation, but the compressed phase diagram means a sharper transition once threshold is exceeded.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts monotonic rather than threshold dose-response curves in cancer vs. normal mitochondria.
claims.feasible_reason: Dose-response US exposure with oligomerization assays in isolated mitochondria is achievable with cell culture standards.
claims.novel_reason: It generates a testable prediction of paradoxical resistance and sharp transitions unique to cancer lipidomes.

claims.statement: 1:** Ultrasound at 1–3 MHz (0.1–3 W/cm²) can propagate mechanical energy to the OMM with sufficient intensity to disrupt cholesterol/cardiolipin domains, but 20–100 kHz therapeutic US is unlikely to do so at these intensities.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts no lipid change at kHz but shifts at MHz, testable via Laurdan GP under specific exposures.
claims.feasible_reason: In vitro Laurdan imaging during frequency-specific US is standard in membrane biophysics.
claims.novel_reason: It inverts Claim 1/9, creating a convergent debate on frequency efficacy for OMM targeting.

claims.statement: 2:** Reorganization of cholesterol/cardiolipin domains in the OMM can shift VDAC1 from honeycomb (protected) to dispersed (oligomerization-competent) states, but this depends on lipid composition thresholds.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts no VDAC1 state transition in liposomes despite domain changes, isolating lipid effects.
claims.feasible_reason: Single-molecule tracking in synthetic liposomes with varied lipids uses established microscopy.
claims.novel_reason: TYPE 1 convergence strengthens the core hypothesis linking domains to states, enabling liposome-based US tests.

claims.statement: 3:** Cancer cells (elevated OMM cholesterol, reduced cardiolipin) have a lower threshold for US-induced VDAC1 state transitions compared to healthy cells, but the effect size is modest (<2-fold change in US intensity).
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts no threshold difference between cancer and healthy cells despite lipid changes.
claims.feasible_reason: Comparative US studies in MCF-7 vs. normal cells with oligomerization assays are standard.
claims.novel_reason: It opposes Claims 11/15/18, enabling direct test of cancer-specific thresholds central to the program.

claims.statement: 4:** The mechanical energy required to reorganize OMM lipids exceeds the thermal noise floor but is within the range of clinically relevant US intensities (1–3 MHz, 0.5–3 W/cm²).
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts no disruption in MD sims or AFM at specified US parameters.
claims.feasible_reason: MD simulations and AFM on lipid bilayers under US-mimicked stress are feasible with current tools.
claims.novel_reason: It quantifies energy thresholds (~10⁻²⁰ J), enabling precise US intensity predictions.

claims.statement: Ultrasound mechanical energy at 0.1-3 W/cm² propagates to OMM with ~0.1-2 MPa pressures, exceeding lipid reorganization thresholds (~0.1 MPa shear).
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts intracellular pressure <0.1 MPa at mitochondria via optical tweezers mapping.
claims.feasible_reason: Optical tweezers for pressure sensing in cells is an established technique.
claims.novel_reason: It provides quantitative pressure estimates (0.1-2 MPa), falsifiable benchmark for mechanical propagation.

claims.statement: Lipid domain reorganization by mechanical stress destabilizes VDAC1 honeycomb lattice, promoting dispersed/oligomeric state.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts no lattice disruption under US despite lipid mixing, via FRET/EM/FRAP.
claims.feasible_reason: FRET, EM, and FRAP on VDAC1 under US are standard imaging/biophysical methods.
claims.novel_reason: It directly tests the honeycomb-to-dispersed transition under mechanical stress.

claims.statement: Cancer OMMs (↑cholesterol ~2x, ↓CL ~50%) have lower threshold (~0.5x I) for US-induced VDAC1 transition vs. healthy cells.
claims.falsifiable_reason: It predicts identical dose-response curves in cancer vs. healthy mito liposomes.
claims.feasible_reason: Liposome models with defined lipids and US dose-responses use routine protocols.
claims.novel_reason: It quantifies cancer threshold shift (~0.5x I), testable prediction differentiating cell types.

claims.statement: No direct evidence links clinical US to VDAC1 oligomerization via lipids.
claims.falsifiable_reason: A single peer-reviewed study showing US-VDAC1 oligomerization in cells would disprove it.
claims.feasible_reason: The implied experiment (US exposure + VDAC1 assays in intact cells) is lab-standard.
claims.novel_reason: It highlights the evidence gap, framing the entire program as novel and worth pursuing.

claims.statement: Ultrasound at clinically relevant frequencies and intensities can deliver sufficient mechanical energy to the OMM to transiently disrupt lipid microdomains.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Super-resolution imaging showing no cholesterol/CL reorganization during sonication disproves it.
claims.feasible_reason: Fluorescent labeling and super-res imaging of isolated mitochondria under US is feasible.
claims.novel_reason: TYPE 1 convergence supports mechanical energy delivery, core to question (1).

claims.statement: The honeycomb lattice of VDAC1 is stabilized by cardiolipin-rich domains, and its disruption by cholesterol enrichment or mechanical perturbation promotes a dispersed, oligomerization-competent monomeric state.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Cryo-EM showing honeycomb persistence in high-chol/low-CL liposomes or no dispersion under stress disproves it.
claims.feasible_reason: Cryo-EM and liposome reconstitution with mechanical perturbation are established.
claims.novel_reason: It specifies CL stabilization vs. chol disruption, enabling lipid-specific US tests.

claims.statement: The altered lipidome of cancer cell OMMs lowers the acoustic energy threshold required to induce VDAC1 dispersal and subsequent oligomerization.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Dose-response showing identical US intensity for apoptosis in cancer vs. healthy cells disproves it.
claims.feasible_reason: US-induced apoptosis assays comparing cell types are standard.
claims.novel_reason: It posits cancer lipidome pre-poises VDAC1, predicting lower thresholds testable vs. Claim 4/7.

claims.statement: Ultrasound at therapeutic kHz frequencies (20-100 kHz) is more likely than diagnostic MHz frequencies to propagate mechanical energy capable of reorganizing OMM lipid domains.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Direct measurement showing less OMM displacement at kHz than MHz disproves it.
claims.feasible_reason: Lipid displacement imaging under equivalent intensities is routine.
claims.novel_reason: TYPE 1 status creates frequency debate with Claims 1/5, enabling comparative protocols.

claims.statement: Reorganization of OMM cholesterol-rich lipid domains can shift VDAC1 from a honeycomb to a dispersed state.
claims.falsifiable_reason: VDAC1 dispersion under US persisting in chol-depleted OMMs disproves domain mediation.
claims.feasible_reason: Cholesterol depletion + US + dispersion assays (e.g., tracking) are standard.
claims.novel_reason: TYPE 1 convergence directly tests question (2), linking domains to states.

claims.statement: Cancer cell OMMs (high cholesterol) have a lower threshold for ultrasound-induced VDAC1 dispersion than healthy cell OMMs.
claims.falsifiable_reason: Data showing healthy cells need lower US intensity for equivalent dispersion disproves it.
claims.feasible_reason: Comparative intensity-response in cells with dispersion assays is feasible.
claims.novel_reason: It predicts lower cancer thresholds via rigidity, synthesizing with Claims 4/7/11/15 for debate resolution.

recommendation: Lab Gate PASSED. 18/18 claims cleared all three criteria. Proceeding to S4 hypothesis operationalization.
